body:
I did some analysis of Go packages in the wild. Aside from `golang.org/x/[pkg]`, a majority of them are a single parent package that may have sub-packages. Their versioning follows SemVer (with or without the v) or has no version number a majority of the time.

From a quick look, going the SemVer route will just put in place what many are already doing if they are versioning their packages.
